chapter.title: AJF - Core Reference
chapter.para: The AJF Core library provide a set of commons reusable components for use on J2EE server and other Servlet containers.

section.title: ApplicationContext
section.para: The ApplicationContext is responsible of the application configuration. The configuration (properties/values) is stored in the file 'settings.properties'. Some specifics properties are directly accessible as attributes from ApplicationContext.

example.title: Configuration file : 'settings.properties'

section.title: Configuration
section.para: The configuration component is provided by the project "commons-configuration" from the Apache Foundation.

section.title: Create Configuration objects
section.para: You can create configuration objects from the following sources :

The configuration objects could be obtained by the ConfigurationHelper class.
API
newConfigurationFromPropertiesFile(String filePath) create a Configuration object initialized with the properties file entries
newConfigurationFromPropertiesResource(String resourceName) create a Configuration object initialized with the properties resource entries
newConfigurationFromIniFile(String filePath) create a Configuration object initialized with the Ini file entries
newConfigurationFromIniResource(String resourceName) create a Configuration object initialized with the Ini resource entries
newConfigurationFromXMLFile(String filePath) create a Configuration object initialized with the XML file entries
newConfigurationFromXMLResource(String resourceName) create a Configuration object initialized with the XML resource entries
